definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: Dozens of servants scurried through the large foyer.
sentences.chinese: 許多僕役在偌大的門廳中快速地穿梭着。

sentences.english: Such large mud pancakes are created by nature.

sentences.english: The police have broken a big drug operation in this area lately.

sentences.english: A huge human foot d'or, in a field azure;

sentences.english: But at so big of China, difficult way only the does the small corner have?
sentences.chinese: 可是在偌大的中國，難道只有那個小角落有嗎？

sentences.english: Then the vast world of how smaller it?

sentences.english: Two huge, hairy ears stuck up above the snowdrift .

definition: as empty as anything (idiom); completely bereft/to have nothing/vacuous/hollow/empty (argument, head etc)
in a mess/scattered about/in complete disorder
lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
